clueList.clueDetail:
Lateral reading is the act of evaluating the credibility of a source by comparing it with other sources. Think about:
Source evaluation:
Look to see if someone else has already fact-checked the claim.
Go to the original source to understand the trustworthiness of the information
If you're still not sure about its trustworthiness even after you found the original source, read what other people say about the source itself (publication, author, organization).

clueList.clueDetail: One night about the time that Rebeca was cured of the vice of eating earth and was brought to sleep in the other children’s room, the Indian woman, who slept with them awoke by chance and heard a strange, intermittent sound in the corner. She got up in alarm, thinking that an animal had come into the room, and then she saw Rebeca in the rocker, sucking her finger and with her eyes lighted up in the darkness like those of a cat. Terrified, exhausted by her fate, Visitación recognized in those eyes the symptoms of the sickness whose threat had obliged her and her brother to exile themselves forever from an age-old kingdom where they had been prince and princess. It was the insomnia plague.  ---《One Hundred Years of Solitude》
